modules.description: This module implements quaternion-based rotation generation and sampling for 3D space. It provides a super Fibonacci sequence for quaternion construction, along with functions to generate arrays of rotations and quaternions. These operations are used for creating evenly distributed rotational samples in 3D applications like simulations and graphics.

This module implements quaternion operations for representing 3D rotations, including creation from axis-angle and conversion to and from strings. It works with float values and vectors from the V3 module to perform rotation calculations. Use cases include camera orientation in 3D graphics and interpolation of rotational states in animation systems.

This module provides trigonometric operations including cosine and sine calculation, degree-radian conversions, and checks for approximate equality and non-zero distances. It works with floating-point numbers and a custom `cosin` record type to represent cosine-sine pairs, along with 3D vectors for calculating dihedral angles. Concrete use cases include geometric computations in 3D space, handling periodic angles, and robust floating-point comparisons.

This module provides arithmetic operations, magnitude calculations, and normalization for 3D vectors, along with distance metrics and component-wise initialization. It handles 3D vector data, offering string serialization, output formatting, and utilities for debugging or logging spatial data. These functions are suited for tasks like 3D graphics rendering, physics simulations, and spatial analysis where precise vector manipulations are essential.

This module implements 3D rotation matrices with 9 elements representing orthonormal transformations. It supports creating identity, axis-aligned, and arbitrary rotations, composing rotations, converting to/from quaternions and axis-angle representations, and applying rotations to 3D vectors. Typical uses include 3D graphics transformations, physics simulations, and robotics control systems.

This module provides 3D vector arithmetic, rotation matrices, quaternion operations, and trigonometric utilities for geometric computations. It works with 3D vectors, quaternions, rotation matrices, and custom cosine-sine records to handle tasks like camera orientation, physics simulations, and 3D graphics transformations. Specific use cases include calculating dihedral angles, interpolating rotations, generating evenly distributed quaternions, and performing robust floating-point comparisons.
